p: Porcine epidemic diarrhoea (PED) is caused by PED virus (PEDV), which is characterized by enteritis, vomiting, and watery diarrhoea. This leads to massive economic losses in the swine industry with high mortality in suckling pigs [ 1]. PED was first observed in England in 1971 and identified in Belgium in 1978 [ 2, 3]. The disease quickly spread to other European countries such as Belgium, England, Germany, France, and Switzerland in the 1980s, and later to Asian countries including Korea, China, Thailand, and Vietnam [ 4, 5]. Recently, several epidemics were reported in important swine-producing countries such as USA, Canada, and Japan [ 6â€“ 8].
